Description: Rectangular plastic transistor radio coloured red with white accents and a circular dial in the upper right side of the face. A volume dial is located on the upper left side and the maker/company logo (telemisr, meeco) on the lower right side.
Curator's comments: The Egyptian state established a radio service in 1934. The new medium was powerful and it played a key role in Egyptian politics, such as the announcement of the abdication of the monarchy in 1952. The Nasser regime expanded the role of radio programming for political, entertainment and educational purposes. In a country with high rates of illiteracy, audio was essential for the circulation of news, propaganda and to reach the masses. The state company Telemisr manufactured this radio model to make the device available to a wider audience.
